title: Mammography
shortDescription: Low-dose X-ray imaging for breast tissue screening and diagnostics.
imagingPrinciple: Uses low-dose X-rays to capture high-resolution images of breast tissue.

conversionSolutions.conversion_description: Use pydicom + Pillow to embed JPEG pixel data into a DICOM container.
Use MATLAB or ImageJ plugins to convert TIFF images to DICOM format.

typicalResolutionImageDims.voxelSize: 50–100 µm per pixel depending on detector

dataSize.typicalStudySize: 30–200 MB for a 4-view exam; up to GBs for tomosynthesis

acquisitionHardware.equipmentUsed: Dedicated mammography unit with compression paddle; digital or analog detector.

primaryUses: Early detection of breast cancer, screening exams.

radiationSafety.safetyConcerns: Repeated exposure, use shielding if needed. Minimally invasive for patients.

commonPreprocessingSteps: Image enhancement and pectoral muscle removal in processing
Conversion to standard multi-frame DICOM (for tomosynthesis)
compressionMethods: Lossy compression sometimes used for quick transfer, but not recommended for diagnosis

technicalChallenges: Dense breast tissue can obscure lesions
Positioning and compression for consistent image quality
